line.en: It was raining that day...
'Isuka...?'
I turned to the dimly lit garage and called out,\nbut there was no reply.
Like noise, the sound of the rain hitting the\nroof dulled my thoughts.
'...Not here, huh.'
All that was waiting for me when I returned home\nwas an empty garage and...
...A broken glider.
'The wings are bent... And the body, too...'
From the condition of the glider, I could easily\nimagine what had happened.
'Isuka...? Isuka...!!'
I call out my best friend's name, but there's no\nreply.
What could have possibly happened...
Is Isuka alright...?
All kinds of ideas came up and spun around in my\nhead.
I searched the desk for anything that looked like\na letter left behind.
But I couldn't find anything.
Instead...
'...The picture is gone.'
That photo of the clouds was missing from the\npicture frame.
A broken glider and an empty picture frame.
Those were the only traces left behind.
But at the time, I didn't give it much thought.
That's because, even more than that, there was\nsomething else that I really had to worry about.
'Isuka!'
I rushed out of the garage to look for Isuka.
Outside was the dreaded rain that seemed to\nfollow me around everywhere.
I never even thought...
I never even thought that I wouldn't be able to\nsee Isuka again...
When I realized that... my world lost its color\nagain.
Just as forecast, it rained the next day.
The ever-present, miserable rain...
'How is Amane?'
'It's no good. Once she shuts herself in her\nroom, she won't come out.'
Amane stayed shut in her room and wouldn't reply\neven when someone called out to her.
The food that was set in front of her door went\nuntouched.
'...There must have been something shocking\nwritten.'
'...Yeah.'
Early this morning, Tobioka visited the Flying\nFish Manor during the middle of the rain.
He came... to give Amane a letter.
'...Here's that letter.'
'This is Isuka's...'
Amane took the envelope with the letter from\nTobioka.
'I don't know what it says.'
The seal hadn't been broken.
'...Why didn't you give it to me sooner?'
'...Because Misagi's parents told me not to let\nyou and Misagi ever meet again.'
'I agreed with them, too...'
'...I didn't think any good would come from\ngiving you this letter, for either you or\nMisagi.'
'...Is that so?'
'...I thought you'd soon forget about it.'
'When you're young, feelings can change easily.\nYou can... start things anew...'
'...And meet new friends. I thought you and\nMisagi would both forget...'
'I thought that was for the best...'
Tobioka dropped the umbrella from his weak grasp\nat the entrance of the dorm.
Exposing himself to the ever-present rain.
'Sensei, please come in.'
Watching from a little ways away, I urged him in\nwithout thinking. But Tobioka didn't move, as if\nhe hadn't heard me at all.
The rain continues to get Tobioka's clothes wet.
'...But even so, you didn't quit.'
'You stayed shut up in that gloomy garage and\ncontinued building the glider...!'
There was a hint of disapproval in Tobioka's\nvoice.
His glance seemed to be directed at Amane...
'...You, you even took a year off of school...'
It felt like those words were directed toward\nhimself.
'It became a bigger and bigger burden...'
'Accepting that letter, and not giving it to\nyou...'
'That's why, I... I hated all of you...'
Tobioka might have been crying.
But with the rain, I couldn't make out any tears.
'...I'm sorry.'
Soaking wet, Tobioka apologized.
The sight of a remorseful and crying teacher\nbowing his head to students seemed really\nawkward...
But, in some way he looked relieved.
Like a weight that he had been carrying for\nseveral years had finally been lifted from his\nshoulders.
Amane opened Isuka's letter immediately after\nTobioka left.
With trembling hands.
It was a final message to Amane from a friend\nthat she thought hadn't left anything for her\nbehind.
Kotori and I were watching her closely.
Amane's eyes opened wide in shock as she poured\nover the contents of the letter.
An instant later the light in her eyes vanished.
That sparkling light that had always filled\nAmane's eyes like a little child's suddenly\nvanished.
'...What's wrong, Amane?'
Without answering, she aimlessly started walking.
And just like that she climbed up the stairs.
'Amane.'
Then she shut herself up in her room.
In the middle of the rain, Ageha and all of the\nSoaring Club members gathered together.
'...Is that so.'
I told Ageha, Asa and the others about how\nTobioka came this morning and gave the letter to\nAmane.
'What did the letter say?'
'I don't know. Tobioka said he hadn't read it\neither.'
'...So then the only person who has read it is\nthe one shut up in her room?'
'...Amane looked really shocked.'
I remember seeing Amane's profile while she was\nreading the letter.
In an instant, the sparkle in her eyes went out\njust like power being cut to a light.
'The letter probably says why Isuka had to leave,\nright?'
'Probably so.'
'If that's the case, then it probably says\nsomething that makes Amane anxious, right?'
Everyone fell silent.
Everyone thought Asa was right, or least wanted\nher to be right.
But, from what I could tell from Amane's\nreaction, it didn't seem like it.
'What in the world did it say...'
Ageha gently stroked Kotori's head. Kotori was so\nworried about Amane that she looked as if she was\nabout to cry.
'I guess all we can do is wait until Amane comes\nout...'
'At any rate, we can't fly in this weather.'
'They said it was supposed to rain until tonight,\ndidn't they?'
'Kotori.'
'Yeah. Let's take a break for today. We'll\nrestart the test once the rain stops and Amane\ngets better, okay?'
Nobody objected to the club leader's plan.
After the group dismissed, Kotori and I were\ngetting ready to make dinner.
It was still pretty early time-wise, but we\ndidn't know what else to do, so we got started.
Fortunately, tonight we're having stew. The\nearlier we make it, the better it will taste.
'Alright, Hat. Here's a treat!'
'Quack, quackkk!'
Kotori fed some vegetable scraps to Hat.
As she watched him devour his treat she muttered,
'...I wonder why Isuka left Hat here anyway?'
'I wonder. She said her parents were strict, so\nmaybe they wouldn't let her keep him?'
'Yeah...'
Looking at the duck wearing a hat, Kotori went\ndeep into thought.
I gazed out the window as I stirred the pot.
'Miserable rain.'
It started raining before dawn and was still\ncoming down even now.
Even though they said it was supposed to stop in\nthe evening...
'Hey... I wonder why Isuka left that journal?'
'Hm? I wonder.'
'And the picture of the Morning Glory. It was\nstuck inside the journal.'
'She probably just forgot about it, don't you\nthink?'
It was in a secret hiding place when she left the\nFlying Fish Manor.
'...No, I don't think so. I mean, she didn't\nleave anything else behind.'
'I can't imagine that she would forget about the\nmost important thing.'
'...Maybe not.'
But then, why did she leave without it?
'Did you know? Our dorm has a 'NO PIE-ING' rule.'
'Oh yeah, that's right.'
When I became the dorm mother they gave me a list\nof things to watch out for and that was on there.
'That was because Isuka threw a pie, you know.'
'There were other things, too... The other day,\nthey found a time capsule, you know.'
'Yeah.'
Kotori went deep into thought again.
'If we look around, I bet there's even more...\ntraces of Isuka.'
'Maybe so.'
Kotori started scanning her surroundings.
I guess she's trying to look for some of those\ntraces.
'Don't worry about it now, just get to work.'
'Okaaay.'
Looking unsatisfied, Kotori went back to cutting\nvegetables.
The sounds of the pot boiling, the vegetables\nbeing chopped, and the wind and rain echoed about\nthe room.
I was starting to get worried about the glider.
It's been sitting on the runway since yesterday.
There was the thing with Tobioka, so we weren't\nable to take it apart.
I mean, I carefully covered it up with a sheet,\nbut...
'(I wonder if it's been blown away...)'
Actually I wanted to gather it all into the\ngarage by the end of today, but An-chan hadn't\nbeen around since this morning.
We didn't have any way to carry it by ourselves\nwith all this rain, so it's just sitting out\nthere.
It should be fine in a little bit of rain.
'I guess I'll go take a look in a little\nwhile...'
Once dinner is ready.
After we finished preparing dinner, I left the\ndining hall and saw someone leaving through the\nentrance.
'(Was that Kanako...?')'
With that on my mind, I went to check on Amane\nwhen Kanako came down the stairs from the second\nfloor.
'Huh, Kanako? Then, who was...'
'Hey, Aoi. Do you have a minute?'
'What is it?'
'Just a minute ago I picked this up outside of\nMochizuki-senpai's room...'
Kanako pulled out a scrap of paper.
It was a folded up sheet of loose leaf paper.
I took it and opened it.
'I heard Mochizuki-senpai come out of her room,\nso I went to check up on her, but...'
It was Isuka's letter.
I read the contents of the letter and understood.
I understood the reason why the light, the light\nlike a starry sky, vanished from Amane's eyes in\nan instant.
'What's wrong, you two?'
Kotori brought Hat out of the dining hall with\nher.
I gave the letter to Kotori with trembling hands.
'What's this?'
'It's Isuka's letter.'
Seeing my pale face, Kotori braced herself.
Then she skimmed over the contents of the letter.
'...What is this?'
She was shocked.
'Amane just left her room a minute ago. I'm going\nto go look for her.'
'Me too...'
'You stay here and watch the phone. There might\nbe a call.'
'Tell Asa and the others about this. And Ageha,\ntoo. Could you get them to help look as well?'
'...Yeah, okay.'
Once I had told Kotori what to do, I rushed\noutside.
Dear Amane,
I don't think I can stay here any longer. So I'm\ngoing to tell you the truth.
I'm a liar.
I've been deceiving you the whole time.
I made a promise, right?
I'll take you to that passage of clouds.
I was sincerely happy that you believed me.
But, that was a lie.
I didn't really believe in it. That the Morning\nGlories would come.
That something that hadn't happened for more than\n20 years... would happen while I was here.
I thought there was no way we'd be so lucky.
You would often call me a genius.
But, you were wrong.
The real genius is you, Amane.
I'm just a normal girl who does things a little\ndifferently than other people.
Someone who's too self-conscious (haha).
So I was happy when I got you to say, 'Great!'\nAnd I wanted you to say it more...
So I lied to you.
I deceived you by holding on to a dream I didn't\neven believe in.
But because of that lie, you didn't go to college\nand stayed behind at Keifuu Private Academy.
My lie tied you down to that tiny little garage.
It was hard, Amane.
I want to be near you. I want to be your friend.\nBut my selfishness has messed up your life.
It was so hard and painful, that I tried to get\nour glider flying just a little somehow. But I\ncouldn't.
My wings are fake. There's no way I could fly.
I'm a cowardly liar.
I'm so ashamed. I want to disappear.
Will you listen to my last request?
Please, forget about me.
And, please, go to where you really belong.
I'm sorry, Amane...
I thought there had to be some kind of reason.
Some unavoidable circumstance.
If not, I couldn't believe that Isuka would run\noff somewhere without me.
But...
'It was my fault... wasn't it...'
The heavily falling rain beats against my body.
Against this hopeless, stupid me.
'...What was I expecting?'
Surely, there must be kind truth hidden there...
That everyone would be rewarded for all those\nlonely days spent in that garage.
Somewhere inside me, I had been expecting that.
'I'm no genius, Isuka...'
I'm just a fool.
The glider we left on the runway still had the\nsheet covering it, and was being doused by the\nrain.
The silhouette of the forward-swept wing.
A fragment of the dream that Isuka and I had\ndreamt up.
...I was the only one who felt that way.
'What fragment of a dream... Don't make me\nlaugh.'
Suddenly I lost all the strength in my body.\nBefore I knew it, I had fallen to my knees.
I splashed loudly in the water puddles.
'Because I came up with this... Isuka and\nTobioka-sensei...'
I tied everyone down.
This isn't a dream at all.
It's a curse.
With my powerless hands I took the sheet off of\nthe glider.
What appeared below was a dull colored wing\nreflecting the dull rain clouds.
'These stupid... wings...'
I took aim at those wings...
'Hello, is that Ageha?'
'Aoi? How are things over there?'
'She wasn't at the school.'
'Then that means...'
'If she didn't go home, then she must have gone\nthere.'
'Right. I'll head over too.'
'Alright, I'm counting on you.'
We split up to look for Amane, running about in\nthe rain.
'She wasn't in the garage...'
I'm getting impatient.
Just trying to imagine Amane's state of mind\nright now makes me feel a stabbing pain.
That letter upset everything she knew.
Everything she believed.
Everything she held dear.
Everything.
'For Isuka herself to deny her own 'promise'...'
After Isuka left, that was the only thing Amane\nrelied on. That's how she made it this far.
No matter what happened, the one thing she had\ntried to believe in was that she didn't want to\nlose Isuka.
Last summer, she aimed for the Morning Glory and\nfailed. So she gave up on her dream once, but...
With all of us, she wanted to aim for them again.
After all that...
'...Why?! Damn it!'
The letter that I thought would save Amane\nbetrayed and knocked her down.
I ran.
I didn't care if I stepped in the puddles or got\nrained on.
'Huff, huff, huff...!'
Before I knew it the rain had stopped.
I ran through the bushes, hurrying toward the\nrunway.
'Amaneeee!!'
I shouted at the top of my lungs as I ran down\nthe runway.
Mud splashed up at my feet.
'Hmm?'
I could see the white aircraft in the distance.
The sheet that I had covered the glider with had\nbeen taken off.
'Huff, huff, huff... Amane!!'
Amane was there.
It looked like she was clinging to a wing that\nwas laying on the ground.
'Amane...'
'AAAAAAHHH!!'
When I spoke to her, Amane suddenly lifted her\nhands into the air. Then she hit the wing with a\nrock.
Bang, bang, over and over again.
'Amane, what are you doing?!!'
I grab Amane from behind and try to pull her away\nfrom the glider.
'Arg, grr, aaah! It's, all... because, of\nthis...'
'Calm down, Amane!'
I hold her tight while she kicks and struggles.
'Amane, please, calm down...'
'Err... hmf, arg... urk...'
Amane's hands went limp.
At the same time, the rock she was holding falls\nto the ground.
I kept on holding her tightly and stroked her\nback, trying to calm her down.
'Amane...'
'Hmf, hmf... arg... hf...'
'Aoi!'
Ageha came running towards us from the distance.
Behind her was Asa and Yoru. Then Kotori and, for\nsome reason, An-chan.
'So you were here!'
'...Amane, are you crying?'
Seeing Amane wrapped up in my arms, Kotori\nanxiously says,
Finding the area where Amane had been hitting the\nwing, Ageha runs up to us.
There were countless scratches from the rock\nhitting it.
'...Amane did it.'
'Why... You're joking, right?'
'Uuugh...'
I let go of Amane.
Somehow she managed to stand on her own.
'We read it. We read Isuka's letter.'
'I don't know what to say...'
'It's my fault, everyone... Because I was here,\nIsuka...'
'That's not true!'
Amane shook her head weakly.
'...I was just a burden.'
'Isuka didn't mess up my life. It was the other\nway around...'
'Even so, I...'
'Because I clung onto that promise like a fool, I\neven caused trouble for Tobioka-sensei...'
'At this rate, I'm going to mess up your lives\ntoo...'
'That's why we should just break these wings\nnow...!'
Amane attempts to pick up the rock again.
'Please stop, Amane!'
I grab her arm to stop her.
'But... but aren't I right!?'
'Because of me, all of you have been tied down to\nthat garage and have been... continuing this!'
'Everyone, it was all a lie.'
'It's not a lie.'
'No matter what Isuka thinks... It was a real\ndream for us.'
Everyone stares at Amane and nods.
Their feelings are sincere.
But, Amane's eyes are blank.
The words don't reach Amane's closed-off heart.
The emotional trauma that Amane felt is much,\nmuch deeper.
'My foolish dream makes everyone unhappy. I'm\nasking you, Aoi... let go of my hand.'
'No.'
'Aoi.'
Amane grabs my arm tightly, looking up and\npleading with me.
If I don't let go, she won't be able to live\nnormally...
I could sense such an urgent plea from within\nthose blank eyes.
'(Amane was about to be crushed by her\nextraordinary grief...)'
What should I...
How can I...
Is holding her the only thing I can do?
Is that all that lovers are good for in the end?
'Hey Amane, do you have a minute?'
An-chan had been watching silently, but now he\nspoke up.
Amane stops trying to get loose from me and turns\nher gaze toward An-chan.
'...Actually, I have some business with you.\nThat's why I came to see you.'
'With... me?'
An-chan nods his head.
'The other day Asa and Yoru told us which care\nfacility Isuka was at, right?'
'Yeah...'
'I went there, to the care facility.'
'What?'
Everyone was surprised, except Kotori. She nodded\nslightly.
'Igarashi-san came to the Flying Fish Manor to\ntell me about that.'
Then he heard about Isuka's letter and brought\nKotori here, huh.
'The Misagi Family is famous in their home town,\nright? I figured the care facility must also be\nclose, right?'
'So I searched everywhere trying to find a place\nlike that.'
'You found it...?'
An-chan's expression neither confirmed nor denied\nmy question.
'Isuka's care facility, if you can even call it\nthat, was officially the Misagi Family vacation\nhome.'
'Isuka is...'
An-chan shook his head.
'No way...'
She's already dead...?
I wasn't the only one who had such a bad feeling.
Everyone else looked uneasy, but An-chan had a\ngentle smile on his lips.
'...It was after she had recovered and left.'
'Well, as to where is she now...'
'I was just thinking about going to look for her.\nBut before that, there's something I want to\nreport to Amane.'
'Isuka said she was safe.'
'Thank you, Tatsuya. But, have you...'
'The letter. I'm sorry, but I've already read\nit.'
'I want to understand how shocked you are,\nbut...'
'...I think I've realized something. She was\npushing herself too much.'
'You know, don't you? I loved her.'
Amane weakly shook her head.
'...I didn't know that.'
'...I see.'
'...Isuka got better then...'
Amane looked relieved, but somehow she also\nlooked lonely.
'After she dropped out, Isuka's condition got\nworse. Apparently she had no choice but to go\ninto long-term care.'

'I guess things weren't going well with her
parents either, so they used her illness to keep
her shut up in their vacation home. It seems she
was basically under house arrest.'
'House arrest...?'

The Misagi Family is quite prominent in their
area. Tobioka-sensei thinks the house arrest
might have had something to do with worrying
about the family's reputation.
'Isuka got out of there about a half a year ago.'
'It looks like this... was what got her out of\nthere.'
Saying that, An-chan took out a picture from his\nbreast pocket.
'Hm? What do you mean by 'this'...?'
It was a familiar picture of clouds.
It was a picture looking up at a road of clouds\ncrossing the sky.
Right... one year ago we flew in those clouds.
Amane found something in those clouds.
I noticed it after her.
Beneath the glowing orange clouds, there was a\nsmall, bird-like shadow.
'Our glider...'
'The Misagi Family vacation home was next to a\nlake. From here it's pretty far away in the\nopposite direction.'

'Last summer, Isuka saw these strange clouds and
went out to the lake with one of the helpers.
From there she saw a glider aiming for the
passage of clouds.'
Amane was gazing at the scene in the picture.
In the same way, the rest of us were also staring\nat that familiar scene.
At the sky we flew in, one year ago.
'Isuka was watching, too...'
'Like we were watching...'
'Yeah...'
'If this picture was the reason she left that\nhouse, then that means...?'
'According to the caretaker, up until that point\nIsuka had given up on everything. She was like a\nrecluse.'
'But seeing that sight... watching you guys fly\nin those clouds that you had aimed for, he said\nit changed her.'

'She focused on her recuperation, got her
strength up, and persuaded her parents... It was
half a year ago when she finally got out of
there.'
'A strange coincidence...'
'...I wonder if it's really a coincidence?'
'Huh?'
'My sister saw those clouds and spotted the\nglider, too.'
'That's because she's always been in love with\nthe sky. She looks up at it all the time.'
'I was different. If it weren't for my sister, I\ndefinitely wouldn't be here.'
'Isuka is probably the same as my sister...'
'...She was always looking up at the sky.'
Yoru nods quietly.
'It might be a coincidence, but... she met with\nit because she was looking for it.'
She could meet with such a miraculous coincidence\nall because she single-mindedly pressed on and\naimed for the clouds.
Would you call that a coincidence?
'...Thank you, Tatsuya. You've put my mind to\nrest, a little.'
'Amane...'
'Everyone, thank you. I'm sorry I damaged the\nwings...'
Amane laughs sadly.
'...I'm glad Isuka is safe. It's really good that\nshe got out again.'
'Now I can forget, too...'
'Forget what? Do you mean Isuka?'
'Yeah. Her and the glider...'
Amane speaks apologetically.
'You can't...'
'Amane, why? That day that we flew, it wasn't for\nnothing.'
'I don't share Isuka's hopes anymore. And, I\ndon't think I can have the same dream as everyone\nelse either.'
'Amane...'
'Where was Isuka aiming to go? Why did she want\nto go there? That's what I wanted to know...'
'What I wanted to know was how she saw this\nworld.'
'...But, it was a lie. Nothing's going to change\nthat, right?'
'So I have no reason to fly anymore.'
'Amane...'
It might be just like Amane says.
For Amane, the Morning Glory wasn't something she\nwas aiming for herself.
It was just a promise with Isuka... Amane wanted\nto know so much more about her, that's why she\nwas trying so hard.
But the letter destroyed that whole premise.\nAmane lost her reason to try.
The words she said to us when we looked to her\nfor help and advice still ring in my ears.
...I can't share the same dream as all of you\nanymore.
Wanting Amane to fly was our hope, not Amane's.
'I wonder if that's really so...'
Kotori sighed.
'I wonder if that's really what Isuka was hoping\nfor...'
'...What do you mean? Isn't that what the letter\nsaid?'
The letter didn't seem to say that she lied to\nAmane because she was worried about her.
Isuka would have certainly known how much that\nletter would hurt Amane.
But it had to be written.
She had so many feelings of guilt about 'telling\na lie.
'It's not just that. Isuka also... took that\npicture from the garage. The one of the Morning\nGlory from when we first started.'
'The broken glider and that empty picture\nframe... they were a message telling me to throw\nmy dreams away...'
If she wanted Amane to hang on to her dreams, I\nthink she would have left the picture.
But Kotori says.
'I just don't think that's what Isuka really\nmeant.'
Everyone looks at Kotori.
I don't know what Kotori is trying to say.

But, I want her to say something... some words
that we can believe in, that tell us that what we
have held dear wasn't a mistake... something
along those lines.
'I, I... understand a little... how Isuka feels.'
'Isuka wasn't very healthy, right? She took time\noff from school a lot because she thought she\nmight die, right...?'
'I mean, she thought she might die at some\npoint... right?'
'Yeah, that's right.'
'...I-I also... used to be like that.'
Kotori grabbed at the hem of her skirt tightly,\ntrying to endure embarrassment.
From that, we all knew that she was trying to\nopen up to us about her difficult past.
'I, was like that so... I never fit in at school\nand I couldn't make any friends. So I often\nmissed school...'
'I became more and more isolated... Every single\nday was terrible... It was so hard that I started\nto hate even living...'
'...Once, I actually tried to quit school.'
'If I hadn't met Aoi or Ageha or Amane... I'm\nsure I would have.'
'I'm the same... so, I understand... how Isuka\nfeels.'
While Kotori was speaking so passionately, Ageha\nmoved closer and rested a hand on Kotori's\nshoulder.
As if that hand had given her some courage,\nKotori begins speaking again.
'I think Isuka wanted to leave something behind.'
'Before she left this place, she wanted to leave\nbehind some proof that she had been here...'
'I mean, isn't there a lot still here? Traces of\nIsuka.'
The strange rules of Flying Fish Manor, the duck\nnamed Hat, the time capsule, the flight log in\nKotori's room, and the glider.
If we looked for more, surely many more would pop\nup.
'I always thought Isuka was strange because she\nleft so many things behind.'
'But, I'm starting to think that might not be\nright.'
'That notebook that was in my room\ Isuka's\nflight log.'
'She didn't forget about it when she left. She\nwanted someone to read it, to read what's written\nin it.'
'I think Isuka definitely wanted us to know. She\nwanted us to know that 'A girl named Isuka Misagi\nlived here.''
'That she looked up at the sky and aimed for\nthose beautiful clouds.'
'That's why she had to leave the picture inside\nthe notebook. So we could see the place where she\nand everyone else had aimed for.'
Without that picture, it would've just been a\ndiary that some strange girl had forgotten.
That picture, with its magnificent and beautiful\nscene that can captivate your heart at first\nglance, breathed life into the diary.
There's no mistake that that was a necessary\ndetail to Isuka.
And without that, Kotori wouldn't have aimed for\nthe sky.
Isuka herself must have found the a picture in an\nold Soaring Club flight log in that garage, which\nmade her aim for the sky.
'I became sure of that just now.'
'The picture that Igarashi-san brought us. Isuka\nleft it behind in the care facility, right...?'
'Yeah. There were lots of pictures of clouds\ncompletely covering the walls of that empty\nroom.'
'It was as if she were trying to convey the\nemotions she got to anyone who visited...'
'I think Isuka was lonely. Saying goodbye to her\nfriends and being forgotten.'
'At the very least she wanted to be remembered by\nsomeone, anyone... That's why she left the\nnotebook behind in the Flying Fish Manor.'
'But she wasn't the kind of person who could say\nthat aloud herself, for sure.'
'I-I'm like that in some ways too... so I know.'
Kotori sounded embarrassed. She held the hand her\nsister had put on her shoulder.
But now she sounded different. Like she was\nconfirming that she has friends who could say the\nsame thing.
'But... who she really wanted to be remembered by\nwasn't some faceless stranger.'
'Where Isuka really wanted to remain was, of\ncourse, inside of Amane.'
'Even if... she died at some point, if Amane\nwould remember her, it would be okay.'
'Even if she didn't believe... her desire to show\nthe Morning Glory to Amane wasn't a lie!'
'She wanted to look up at those beautiful clouds\ntogether and share in the same exhilaration.'
'I mean, that would definitely be something you\nwould remember your whole life.'
Before I noticed it, tears were welling up in\nKotori's eyes.
It was as if Isuka's thoughts had been\ntransferred to Kotori.
'If I had to leave school tomorrow, that's what I\nwould want...'
'I'd want everyone to remember me at my\nbrightest.'
'Kotori...'
'Kotori...'
'The me from a year ago didn't have anyone like\nthat. But, meeting Aoi, Ageha, Amane and the\nglider...'

'And then, and then... meeting Asa and Yoru, and
Igarashi-san, everyone at the Flying Fish Manor,
the student council president, Ageha's sister,
and lots of others...'
'I'm the happiest I could be now!!!'
'I think Isuka was definitely the same...'
'Even if the promise was a lie, her desire to fly\nwith Amane and Igarashi-san couldn't have been a\nlie.'
Even with Kotori's tear-filled eyes staring at\nher, Amane didn't flinch.
'Amane, how was it?'
'Do you think the time you spent with Isuka was a\nlie?'
Amane shook her head silently.
Hanging her head down, she made a face like she\ndidn't know what to do and bit her lip hard.
Amane was trembling.
Like she was frightened.
She wants to start walking,
but is too afraid to start.
That's how she looked.
'There's no way Isuka is a liar.'
Amane raised her head and looked at me.
'The only one who can prove that is you, Amane.'
'Me, prove...?'
I nodded.
Then I move next to the glider.
'These are the wings that you designed for Isuka.\nTo aim for those clouds together...'
'But, that's...'
'You should fly, Amane. With this glider.'
'And 'pass through the passage of clouds.'
'That's right... If you fulfill the promise, the\nlie won't be a lie anymore.'
'Let's fly, Amane. To prove that Isuka isn't a\nliar.'
'We're going to take you to the place that you\npromised.'
'Yeah!'
'Right!'
'Nice idea.'
'I'll help!'
'Everyone...'
Amane looked at everyone, dumbfounded.
Then she nodded timidly.
'Take me... to the other side of those clouds.'
An orange ray of light pierced through the sky\nfrom the west.
'Oh, the sky's cleared up...'
Just as the weather report said, the rained\nstopped by evening and the clouds cleared up.
And the setting sun was poking through the gaps\nin the clouds that had formed.
Bathed in that light, the wet glider glistened\nred, like it was on fire.
It was as if it had come back to life.
Kotori looked at the sky in the opposite\ndirection of everyone else and opened her eyes\nwide.
'Look... at the sky over there.'
Everyone looked at where Kotori was pointing.
What was there was...
'...The sky, it's dyed blue.'
The eastern sky was a bluish purple.
'What a pretty sky... it looks just like the\nsunrise.'
'Hey, Aoi... is that?'
'Y-yeah...'
We all gazed dumbfounded at the sight.
It was the sight we had been waiting to see for a\nyear.
The sky we had yearned and prayed for.
'But, to come at such a timing...'
I looked at Amane standing next to me.
'Aaah...'
Amane stared at that sunset sky, as if she were\nseeing something that she didn't believe in.
'I saw this here, last summer, too...'
'There's no mistaking it, is there?'
'Hm? What's going on, everyone...?'
'Could it be, what you were saying before...'

It was a miraculous coincidence. But for all of\nus who had been anxiously looking up at the sky,\nday after day, it was only inevitable.
'It's coming, tomorrow morning... the Morning\nGlory!'
Isuka and Amane's promised day.
